Posts.Content: I'm sorry you are in such pain. I too have used the diaper rash meds, they seem to help. Would not recommend that you soak in a tub though, especially if you have a yeast infection. Nothing new to add, but letting the area get some air is a good thing. I wish you lots of luck, just be patient, this will pass. Hang in there! Hugs, Cheyenne
Posts.Title: Need help ..sensitive subject .. private area is raw and inflamed from constipation (5 days with movement) .. I need help

Posts.Content: You guys are awesome! I have received so much hope and peace from this site. I don't post much, I feel more comfortable just reading, unless I am moved to do so. Sometimes its good to just let some steam off. :) I think you all are amazing, and it makes my day just coming on and reading what you have to say. Thanks for sticking around, keep up the good work, you are truly a blessing for others. May God bless you, and keep you in his light. Thanks everyone!
Posts.Title: FOR ZAHALENE! You made my day!

Posts.Content: I am 35 now, I had my first mammo at age 32. My breasts are very lumpy, and it was important to watch it. I had a biopsy when I was 32, because I had a large lump, but it turned out to be a cyst. When I was dx at the end of July, 2009, the tumor was in the same spot that the cyst had been in. I have no family history of breast cancer. My sister called her doctor to schedule a mammo last week, but because of her age, they refused! She is 28. I told her to switch doctors. I feel that women should have mammos at 30 or 35, not 40. It needs to be done earlier. Early detection is so important. My daughter is only 8 now, but I am going to insist that she be tested early on.
Posts.Title: Mammogram for the under 40
